dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. NYC. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A quiet, deserted industrial street. It is over an hour b dawn and the street is still cloaked in the heavy stillne of night. In the weak light filtering out of their battered van, BE and CYBIL -- the Craft Service Managers, finish setting o breakfast supplies on a 6' table. They work in almost com silence, both nearly paralyzed with sleep. A cheap walkie talkie, lying beside a paper plate of soggy Oreos, sputte and buzzes occasionally. Other items on the table include mangled banana, seven grapes, and a box of chocolate cove donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This milk is bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffs) When did you buy it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuesday? I don't know. What's today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monday. (pause) There's a deli on Broadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing closer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing that's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffs the milk) Is it that bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You're the one who  said it was bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment a large truck grinds around the corner and shudders to a stop in front of the building. Bert replace the carton of milk neatly beside the orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid low, one-word greetings, the CREW tumbles out of the trucks and stands in a groggy cluster around the Craft Se table. WOLF -- the Cameraman, assumes a place of prominen He wears a black leather coat, a black beret, and black  leather half-fingered gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the worst fucking coffee  I've had in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't drink it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we doing today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls out a wrinkled  callsheet) "Interior. Living Room. Ellen talks  to Mom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any nudity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you have to take your fucking  pants off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it. I like Ellen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's a babe. She was the nurse  in that Richard Gere movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shower scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start with the 5K in the window. Run  feeders for three blonds into the  living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two people. Sitting? Standing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who fuckin' knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walks off) "Ellen talks to Mom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICOLE sits quietly in the back seat of a beat-up station wagon. She glances out at the empty city moving past her  window and lets out a deep sigh. JEFF, the young intern assigned as her driver, glances in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've been up since four. I've  got a big scene today and I'm kind  of nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ellen talks to Mom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you read the script?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's on the callsheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, it's pretty emotional. I  tell my mother I never felt she really  loved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to yell at each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm just going to go  with how I feel. Which is the scary  part. I'm very close to this  character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problems with your own mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But she died before I, well  before we could reconcile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great in that Richard Gere  movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU sidewalk. A pair of women's orthopedic shoes enter the frame and begin pacing. Camera pans up to reveal CORA, a small woman in her early 60s, pacing beneath the awning of her residential hotel. appears to be rehearsing dialogue with herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, I have no memory of this  whatsoever. Ellen... Ellen I have NO  memory of this whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff pulls the car up to the curb and Cora gets into the  back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, "Mom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gruff) Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora immediately lights a cigarette. Nicole instinctively wrinkles her nose and turns away. Cora notices this and m an exaggerated effort to keep the smoke away from Nicole blowing it hard out the side of her mouth. Jeff glances b at the two women in the rearview mirror. No one speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK -- the Director, WOLF -- the Cameraman and WANDA -- AD, stand in a loose triangle on the darkened set. All ar holding coffee cups. The Gaffer can be seen in the backgr fumbling with a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not blaming anybody, Wanda.  I'm just saying we left last night  and I knew we didn't get that scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I thought it was a great  scene, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was OK; and it's going to be  alright. But I'm not settling for OK  today. This is a big scene and I'm  not leaving till we get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes, Nick. We're here  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, here's what I'm thinking.  Wolf, I want to do the whole scene  in one shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that but I'd like to try it  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handheld.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dolly. We go from Close-up to  Wide-shot and back to Close-up in  the same shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll use the 35, minimize distortion;  I'll light it all from the ceiling.  It could be kind of great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds incredible. How long, Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need to see a couple run- throughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too many. It's a tough scene for  the actors. I want them to feel  relaxed, fresh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got all day, Nick. Whatever it  takes. What do you think, Wolf -- an  hour, 45?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you drink that shit  black, Nick. I got to dump in the  milk. It's the only way I can cut  the taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the Gaffer turns on the 5K, flooding the room wi harsh, blinding light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flame on, asshole!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen goes completely WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screen is still white. Gradually it shifts back to proper exposure revealing NICOLE in Medium CU. Her eyes are rive it is obvious she is emotionally primed for the scene. A  light meter is thrust in front of her face. She barely  registers it. WS, the entire Living Room set. Nicole sits on a sofa fac Cora seated opposite in an overstuffed chair. Two flats h been joined at right angles to create the Living Room cor A table lamp and assorted framed photographs complete the rather scrawny looking set. Most of the movie crew is seen, including Wolf looking th the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, picture's up. Quiet. Stop the  work. Lock it up. Going for picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick approaches Nicole and Cora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, nice and easy. Cora you're doing  fine. Remember, really listen and  really answer. (smiles at Nicole) I've got nothing to say to you. Just  let it happen. It's all there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this a second, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick moves behind the camera and looks through the eyepie Another CU of Nicole fills the frame. The image is visual and emotionally breathtaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pushed in a foot. She's incredible.  It's coming right through the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick grips Wolf's shoulder in gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, man. Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take one. (hits the sticks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the moment Nick calls "action" the film will cut dir to the shot the set camera is filming. The shot is fluid, graceful and in richly, beautiful COLOR. Nicole's perform is very strong; flawed only slightly by her nervousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad hit me first and knocked me down.  It didn't hurt that much but I started  crying anyway, hoping he would leave  me alone. He went over and started  hitting Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, I have no memory of this  whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just standing there looking  at me. Then you pulled me up and  said, "You're not hurt." Like I was  disgusting for faking, for doing the  only thing I could think of to keep  him from hitting me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was worried about Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was smaller than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole turns to Cora with the heartbreaking gaze of an  abandoned child. Nick and the rest of the crew watch in a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were so worried about Danny --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the BOOM dips all the way into the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut! Boom in. Sorry, I had to cut.  Les, your boom was all the way in  the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where's the frame line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the crew move around, all talking at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, can we get a frame line? Hold it  down. We're going again right away.  Nobody moves. Les, you got the frame  line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, here we go. Right away. Picture's  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick approaches Nicole and Cora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful; both of you. Stay focused.  Stay with it. No big deal. Let's go,  Wanda. Right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll sound!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take two. (hits the sticks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad hit me first and knocked me down.  It didn't hurt that much but I started  crying anyway, hoping he would leave  me alone. He went over and started  hitting Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image suddenly goes out of focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I have to cut. I was  completely off on the focus. It's my  fault, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the apology but you'll  never work in this town again. (laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go, right away. Lock it up.  And roll sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll Camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take three. (hits the sticks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene begins once again. Remarkably, Nicole's enormou commitment is just as full and sharp. Nick is in ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad hit me first and knocked me down.  It didn't hurt that much but I started  crying anyway, hoping he would leave  me alone. He went over and started  hitting Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, I have no memory of this  whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a car stops right outside, a heavy, bass-driven song blasting out of its trunk-mounted speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Street noise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a cut! (into her walkie) What the fuck's going on down there!?  You call that a lock-up!? Get that  car out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Why doesn't the guy  just get a flatbed trailer with about  600 speakers on it and tow it behind  his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone nods in annoyed agreement; everyone except the B man who appears to be following the music with the mike,  bopping to it through the headphones. Slowly, interminabl the music fades off into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... it's clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into her walkie) Do I have a lock-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: kkkkkssst... sttttss yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a real lock-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ssssssssssssppppkkss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, right away. Picture's up. Roll  sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take four. (hits the sticks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad hit me first and knocked me down.  It didn't hurt that much but I started  crying anyway, hoping he would leave  me alone. He went over and started  hitting Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, I have no memory of this  whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just standing there looking  at me. Then you pulled --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the BOOM drops into frame again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom's in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole left side of frame, Les.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, can we please get a  motherfucking frame line please?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frame keeps changing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the idea, Les.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I make a suggestion? Is it  possible to maybe break the shot  down? Maybe two shots instead? Might  make it easier for Les.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I need ten minutes to switch to  radio mikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your call, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be any other sound  problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more boom problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switch to radios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a ten-minute break. Release  the lock-up. Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the AC) Get me a coffee. Half milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks for Nicole but sees only Cora standing by the  couch. Les has both arms up the back of her dress, runnin the wire to her radio mike. She's wearing stockings rolle down to just above her knees. Nick turns and spots Nicole by herself in a dark corner o the set and walks over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about all this, Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault, Nick. Is there  a way to use some of the earlier  takes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless I change the shot; do a  cutaway of Cora or something and  intercut the takes. I don't want to  do that. It's a really nice shot and  what you're doing is incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio mikes are going to make  everything easier. So, look. Take a  moment. Let all this shit go. We  don't roll till you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick moves back to the set, leaving Nicole in the shadows Camera stays on her as she begins emotionally preparing  herself once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was she in that Richard Gere  movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So-so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera slips halfway through an open bedroom door, holdin Nicole on one side of the frame while revealing PAM the S Supervisor and CYBIL sitting on the floor smoking. Though separated by the wall, Nicole hears everything the two wo say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her career really took off, didn't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her in a Michael Bolton video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is nice; but I could do a better  job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera slips into a CU of Nicole. She closes her eyes as two women continue talking about her. Screen goes BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK scrim, held by the Gaffer, passes in front of the camera, revealing the set with Nicole and Cora settling i for a take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that flag going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a scrim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two seconds, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No more tweaking. Picture's up. (into her walkie) Lock it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf quickly motions Gaffer to hand-hold the scrim in fro of the 5K.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take five. (hits the sticks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again the scene begins. Nicole shows the first signs losing her concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad hit me first and knocked me down.  It didn't hurt that much but I started  crying anyway, hoping he would leave  me alone. He went over and started  hitting Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, I have no memory --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is a tremendous EXPLOSION sending bits of  glass flying through the frame. Cora jumps, clutching her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU the light the Gaffer had been holding the scrim before It is smoking and shattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus fucking Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Gaffer) Kill it. Kill it. Pull the plug.  Right there by your foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a cut. Anybody hurt? Cora,  are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora nods wordlessly, gasping for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Props. Props! Let's get a broom up  here right away. Clear the set!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Cora, and Nicole stand in a corner of the landing.  Nick is making obvious attempts to lighten the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's see. What do you think  is going to happen next, Cora?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have a heart attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. You're going in there  in two minutes and we are really  going to nail this scene. I know it.  I have no doubt about it. Nicole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns to Nicole and stops in midsentence. He looks a her for a long moment. Nicole returns his gaze then sudde looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick! Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hesitates a moment then rushes back to the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you this much right now; I  am never, ever doing another fucking  low-budget movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick joins Wanda and Wolf on the set couch and chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf and I were talking... Ellen's  losing it a little bit. You got three  quarters of the scene really, really  incredible in the first take. Do a  quick cut-away and all you need is a  pickup of the last part of the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I feel; I love this  shot. Hell, I designed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's just stick with the game  plan, OK? It's a simple shot. We're  going to get it this time, I feel  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here for you, Nick. Whatever  it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick moves off. Wanda stares at Wolf who studiously inspe his light meter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera is close on the black-and-white clapboard. Nicole' face can be partially seen behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take six. (hits the sticks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the scene begins again, it is obvious that both actres are completely distracted. Nick's face betrays a rapidly  increasing anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad hit me first and knocked me down.  It didn't hurt that much but I started  crying anyway, hoping he would leave  me alone. He went over and started  hitting Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long awkward pause as Cora realizes she can't  remember her line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut. That's OK, Cora. What's the  line? Just say it to me; no acting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ellen, I have no memory of this  line whatsoever."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid general tittering from the crew, Wanda yells out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, could we get the line please?!  Script!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pam) "Ellen, I have no memory of this  whatsoever."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And, roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take seven. (hits the sticks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene begins again. Nicole is lifeless; she's merely  saying the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad hit me first and knocked me down.  It didn't hurt that much but I started  crying anyway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was worried about Danny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole stops cold, completely thrown by Cora jumping her  line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm lost...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut. It's OK. No big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's voice has the rigid tremble of someone barely able keep from screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone relax. We're just going to  run the lines. That's all. No acting.  Just run the lines. Then we're going  to shoot this fucking scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole gets up quietly and sits next to Cora on the couch wordlessly taking her hand in hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) I'm so sorry. I'm fucking this up  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Cora, don't even think that. You're  doing great. I'm the one who's fucking  it up. If I get through this I swear  I'm never acting again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She means it. Cora glances up at her, seeing for the firs time how pain and defeat have drawn the life from Nicole' face. On an impulse Cora reaches out and gently lifts a s of Nicole's hair from her eyes. A sudden amazed alarm fills Nicole. The living room grows strangely quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faintly, from a  distance) And, action on the run-through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU Nicole. She looks quickly toward Nick in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE to a nurse moving quickly past the camera and ou the open door of the hospital room. CU Nicole, seated on the edge of the hospital bed. Still  confused, she looks down at the old woman lying in the be The woman's face is pale and drawn. As Nicole leans close her mother reaches out and gently brushes a strand of hai away from her face. The gesture is one of love, acceptanc and farewell. It is identical to the one we have just see Cora make to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And action on the run-through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WS, the Living Room Set. Nick, Wanda, the rest of the cre standing quietly. Nicole glances over at Cora and instant something unspoken and unexplained passes between them. T run-through begins. From the moment Nicole opens her mouth it is obvious ther has been a remarkable change in her. Every word now has t stunning clarity of truth. Cora is completely engulfed in the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad hit me first and knocked me down.  It didn't hurt that much but I started  crying anyway, hoping he would leave  me alone. He went over and started  hitting Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, I have no memory of this  whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just standing there looking  at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nicole continues, one by one the crew turn and watch t exquisite moment happening before them. Nick's face is li with rapture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Roll camera... roll camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances over and to his horror sees that no one is beh the camera. He whispers frantically to the AC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) In the bathroom... he doesn't feel  good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Get him! Get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns back to the scene, watching its beauty now in  agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you pulled me up and said,  "You're not hurt." Like I was  disgusting for faking, for doing the  only thing I could think of to keep  him from hitting me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was worried about Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was smaller than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were so worried about Danny.  What about me, Mom? Why weren't you  worried about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a heavy, stunned silence as the scene ends. Nico and Cora are in each other's arms. Pam and Cybil share a  piece of tissue. CUT TO: an extreme CU of Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is Wolf?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cramped confines of the dingy basement bathroom, W pukes violently into the toilet. His face is pale and sli with perspiration. His eyes look upward toward the sound Nick yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf tries to continue but another spasm of nausea wrench him back toward the toilet bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The set is quiet, subdued. Nick sits on the couch with Ni and Cora. Wolf sits groggily behind the camera wiping the sweat from his face. Wanda addresses the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, listen up. Nobody drinks the  milk downstairs. OK? It appears to  be bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick speaks uneasily to Nicole and Cora. He is a wreck an his insistent smile of encouragement looks absolutely  demented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had to, well I've changed the  shot; we're just a little pressed  for time. It'll just be a CU of Ellen  for the last part of the scene,  starting with Cora's "I was worried  about Danny." OK? I'll find a way to  cut this into the fourth take. We  almost had it. That was unbelievable,  both of you. But let's not think  about it. That moment is gone, and...  we'll, we'll get another one. I have  no doubt about it. OK? Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks over and stands beside the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is so angry he can't even look at Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, Pickup, take one. (hits the sticks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene begins at the pickup point. Miraculously, both  Cora and Nicole are just as concentrated and engaged as t were in the run-through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was worried about Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was smaller than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were so worried about Danny.  What about me, Mom? Why weren't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of this final, delicate moment an insistent electronic beeping is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?! Sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantically checking  his equipment) It's not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck it is. It's off; it's not  even running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beep continues, growing louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into her walkie) What's going on down there?! Do I  have a lock-up?! Nothing? You don't  hear a beeping sound? (to Nick) The street's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what the fuck is it!!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's somebody's watch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody holds their watches up to their ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so on, until all watches have been checked with negat results. The beeping continues, growing louder and louder Suddenly Nick loses it. He starts running around the set, ripping things apart, knocking over tables, lamps, chairs He shoves Cora off the couch and whips off the cushions,  heaving them against the wall with a startling violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it!! You motherfucker! You  cock-sucking motherfucking bastard!  Where the fuck are you!? Where!!  Where!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches Nick demolish the set in stunned, open- mouthed amazement. Nick turns to the crew in rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can someone help me please?! Do I  have to do everything myself here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick loses it completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Cora. Why don't you go learn  your lines! Hey Scriptgirl, are you  finally going to pay attention here?!  Hey, focus puller, you want to make  a movie or get stoned?! Huh, I got  some great fuckin' Thai Stick here!  Hey Wolf, you pretentious, beret- wearing motherfucker! I saw your  reel, man; it sucked! Who the hell  would hire you anyway! Hey Wanda,  next time can you wear a shirt that's  a little more distracting to my  actors! (to the Gaffer) Hey Bob! Hi Bob! Can you please make  a little more noise on the dolly you  creaky motherfucker! (to Cybil) What is your name!? What do you  fucking do around here?! (to the Soundman) Hey Speedo, what's the matter? Can't  even find a teeny fucking beep?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of Nicole. She turns away, unable to watch anymore. Th beeping continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what I have to put up with,  Nicole!? Maybe next time you'll do  some of that magic on camera!? But  no, no -- wait till Wolf is puking  his guts out, "Oh now I'll be good!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WS, the entire room. Nick's last word echoes throughout t silent set. Suddenly he stops in the center of the demoli set and lets out a long, wrenching scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUT TO extreme CU Nick's face, just as his eyes ope The film is in COLOR now. The room is in heavy darkness e for the light on Nick's face. Nick reaches over and shuts off his clock radio. The digital dial shows 4:00 A.M. The beeping finally stops. Nick turns on a light and sits up in bed, drenched in swe and still breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God... (this is not a sigh  of relief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera DOLLIES swiftly back away from Nick. He stares it in stunned amazement. Just then a DOOR closes right in the lens turning the frame into complete BLACKNESS. Out of the BLACKNESS a door opens away from the camera  revealing WANDA looking into her closet (the camera is in the closet). From this point on, the rest of the film is COLOR except where specifically indicated to be Black and White.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WANDA'S APT. DAWN
dialogues.text: She is wearing only a bra, black stretch pants, and cowbo boots. She rummages quickly through some blouses, selects the same garish one she wore in Part One, then walks away revealing WOLF sitting on the edge of the rumpled bed. He dressed exactly the same as when we last saw him, complet with beret. He struggles groggily into his socks and boot The entire apartment is in disarray. A bedside clock read 4:13 A.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when did he ask you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday, when I was helping him  check into his hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, the guy can't even check into  a hotel by himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Wolf, having Chad Palomino  in this movie will benefit us all.  If being there when he checks into  his hotel makes him feel better,  then I'm happy to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how did it come up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me if I liked jazz, I said  yes, and he suggested we meet tonight  at a jazz club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like jazz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did not invite you. (applies perfume)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you wearing perfume to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I feel like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't wear it yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it. You're acting like a  child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda playfully swipes at Wolf's face with a negligee she returning to the closet. It misses him completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My eye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Sweetheart, are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look alright?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see. Christ, we're going to  be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda sits and perfunctorily examines Wolf's eye.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR. DAWN
dialogues.text: The car is parked outside a rather seedy hotel. JEFF, the Intern and NICK, the Director, sit quietly in the motionl car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we call up to the room again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he'd be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lets out a huge yawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm exhausted. I dreamt I was on the  set all night. I was just trying to  do one shot and everything kept going  wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an anxiety dream. Are you  anxious about something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Sometimes I wonder  what the hell I'm doing in this  business. It's all just one compromise  and disappointment after another. I  don't know if I have the personality  for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds kind of like an identity  crisis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right. Who am I? What  am I really capable of? Maybe I should  just get a job teaching at a women's  college somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get into cinematography?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a cinematographer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm directing this movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) How'd you get into directing?

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL ROOM. DAWN
dialogues.text: In the dim light of the hotel room, CHAD PALOMINO dresses quickly. He is young, handsome, with long blond hair. A W sits nude on the bed, her back to the camera. The faint s of a shower comes from the adjacent bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're waiting downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, I'll take a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, OK. Listen, I've got to tell  you, I had a lot of fun last night,  really, but for me, where I'm at  right now in my life, a relationship  is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad; hold it. This was a one-time  deal. You know it, I know it. There  is no need for melodrama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought you might...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, all I ask is that you don't  mention this to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's not my style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'll see you on the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino slips out the door. The woman falls back onto th bed, turning her face toward the camera. We see it is NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies for a moment, listening to the sound of the show The bedside clock reads 4:30 A.M.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR. DAWN
dialogues.text: The car pulls up outside a NYC apt building. Jeff, Nick, Palomino sit inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got two films coming up right after  yours, Nick. One I play a rapist  that Michelle Pfeiffer falls in love  with. The other I'm kind of a sexy  serial killer who shacks up with  Winona Ryder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'm not into that hostess  twinkie shit, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostess twinkie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Hollywood shit. It's all fluff,  man. These are the kind of movies I  want to do, right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you feel that way, Chad.  And I just want to tell you, I'm  really happy we can work together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, me too! You're a great director,  man. Your films are wacked! And I'm  gonna be watching you, buddy. Like a  hawk. I want to learn from you, Nick.  I'm gonna pick your brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Then you can pick my nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big laugh) See what I mean? You're wacked. Hey,  what are we sitting here for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're waiting for Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole? She's takin' a tax -- (he stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably taking a shower or something.  Hey, how was her shower scene in  that Richard Gere movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men sit in silence. WS, showing the car parked  outside Nicole's apt, the men inside waiting.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. MORNING
dialogues.text: A small, elegant bedroom set has been constructed in the  middle of the huge empty space. One wall has a fake windo The GAFFER lies on the bed staring absently at the AC sit motionless beside the camera a few feet away. Neither spe for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we got nudity today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads from his  callsheet) It just says "Scene Six: Ellen and  Damian kiss."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be a kiss with nudity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Ellen. She's my type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty. Smart. Kind of kooky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll give her a part. That's  right; I'm makin' my own movie pretty  soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. Feature. I brought my script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gaffer tugs a thin, tattered SCRIPT, folded lengthwis out of his back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino's perfect for the lead. I'm  going to give it to him right during  lunch. Maybe right after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to be aggressive. You want to  shoot it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever shot anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright; got to start  somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the Gaffer reaches out and warmly shakes the AC' hand.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MAKEUP CORNER. DAY
dialogues.text: Nicole sits before the makeup mirror. LORDE, the male Mak artist picks up a tube of Preparation H and begins applyi it under Nicole's eyes just as Nick walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrinking tissue. That's what this  stuff is for. Let that sit for two  minutes, pumpkin; I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. We've been waiting in front of  your apartment for half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I'm sorry, Nick. Something came  up. I forgot to call. I'm sorry, I  feel like such an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just saying that because you  have Preparation H on your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never should have gone out last  night. I hate jazz. God, I look  terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. You really look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in Nick's voice makes Nicole glance up at him. looks away quickly. The moment is awkward, as if they bot realize he has inadvertently revealed something. Just the Palomino approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! How'd you get here, Nicole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, cause we were wondering how you  got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at both of them in a moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, good; everybody's here.  We'll do a run-through as soon as  you guys are ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorde reenters as Nick leaves. Palomino sits in the chair beside Nicole and Lorde immediately begins his makeup. No one speaks.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: The crew is assembled behind the camera. Wolf is now wear a black eyepatch over one eye. Nick is on the set, talkin with Nicole and Palomino. Palomino wears a tuxedo and Nic is in an elaborate low-cut gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it down, hold it down, people.  Actors working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great shirt, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) Why, thank you, Chad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, let's work out the rest of this  blocking. Wolf -- (notices Wolf's  eyepatch) What happened to your eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to be alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks good on you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole is standing here, Chad, you're  there by the chair. Camera is close  on Ellen: her first line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always admired you from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admired? That sounds rather  professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! "Professional," that's the  cue; Damian steps up to the bed.  Camera pulls back. The scene  continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then: loved. How does that  sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like the champagne talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've loved you from the moment we  met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were working together. I didn't  want anything to interfere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. And all this time I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the kiss. How's that feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf, any thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a thought. What about Damian  having an eyepatch like Wolf's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me think about that one, Chad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, you're the genius. Nick Reve,  Living in Oblivion, Scene Six, Take  One. Let's shoot it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second, Chad. You ready for one,  Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I been ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Wolfman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going for picture. Lock it up. And  roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly the film cuts from color to B/W. Chad and Nicol begin their Love Scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always admired you from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admired? That sounds rather  professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera starts to dolly, however Chad does not move. H goes out of frame forcing Wolf to pan abruptly to Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then: loved. How does that  sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like the champagne talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've loved you from the moment we  met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally moves to his  mark) Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were working together. I didn't  want anything to interfere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. And all this time I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino and Nicole embrace. Their kiss, like the entire  scene, is flat, lifeless, and awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut. Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for camera. Chad was completely  out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Chad; what happened, buddy?  Forget your cue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, man. I held back. It really  felt like something Damian would do;  holding back to the last moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. How's that for you, Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care when he moves. Just  give me a fucking cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lone Wolf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What line did he move on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Why didn't you tell me?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, "me" is the new cue. Nicole,  how does that feel to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, if that's what Chad wants to  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Me, me, me," that's the cue. Let's  shoot; I'm stoked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second, Chad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick approaches the bed and speaks quietly to Chad and Ni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad, how would you describe this  scene, in one word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. It's a great scene, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean it's a love scene. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These two people really love each  other. And we want to see that,  especially in the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, say no more, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Here we go. Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going for picture. Lock it up. And  roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always admired you from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino moves immediately to the bed, changing his block and causing the camera crew and Nicole considerable confu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admired? That sounds rather  professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then: loved. How does that  sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like the champagne talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've loved you from the moment we  met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were working together. I didn't  want anything to interfere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. And all this time I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene once again is awful. Nick gives their listless  kiss a few moments then calls CUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, cut. Very good. Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad missed his cue again; the whole  dolly is unusable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Chad. What happened; I thought  you were going to hold back till  "me"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The more I thought about it the more  it didn't seem right. And I'm  thinking, watch me here, instead of  coming around the bed, what if I  just slip here like this and do the  whole scene lying down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, that seems a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm just throwing out ideas  here. Trying to get the juices  flowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole, how does that feel to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can turn to look at him. But  won't you be shooting the back of my  head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus Chad is completely out of the  light down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Wolf; I'm not worried about my  face, man. It's about the acting;  that's all I care about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your call, Nick. His acting or  his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For some reason I was hoping we could  get both. (laughs) I thought that's what we were trying  to do here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to set another light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ahead of schedule, Nick. I  think we can afford a few minutes to  set a light for Mr. Palomino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, let's do it. Ellen, Damian;  let's talk for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick, Nicole, and Palomino step off the set Wanda spea to the crew in general.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll pause to set this light and go  again right away. How long, Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf doesn't answer, though he stands a mere foot away,  watching the Gaffer set up a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf walks away from Wanda without a word. The entire cre watches this.

dialogues.speaker: INT. A CORNER. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick, Palomino, and Nicole confer, all three smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, let's make sure we know what's  going on here. These two people have  loved each other for years, each of  them not knowing the other was in  love with them. And tonight, in this  little room it all comes out. It's  like a dam bursting. Does that make  sense? Nicole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes perfect sense. I just haven't  found it yet. I'll get it though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Chad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm there, man. I got the dam going,  the river, everything. You watch,  that little change in the blocking  is going to open the whole scene up  for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going for picture. Lock it up. And  roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always admired you from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino saunters over and sprawls on the bed, forcing Ni to turn her head completely away from the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admired? That sounds rather  professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then: loved. How does that  sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like the champagne talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've loved you from the moment we  met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were working together -- I'm sorry,  can we cut, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a cut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! That was a good one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm sorry. But this feels  really awkward; turning all the way  around like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think the lying on the bed  is not quite working, Chad. Let's  try one with the original blocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one was that? There's been so  many damn changes. Could somebody  help me out please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cue for the original blocking is  "professional."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intimate) Thank you. Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, right away. Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? Could I just have a moment? Is  that alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Nicole; are you kidding?  Hold the roll, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the roll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole remains seated on the bed, lowering her head and  closing her eyes as she attempts to generate some emotion for the scene. Everyone watches her in complete silence.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NEAR THE CAMERA. DAY
dialogues.text: Palomino tiptoes over to the camera where Wanda and the  Scriptgirl are standing side by side. As he leans between them, checking his lines on the Scriptgirl's script, he  inhales deeply then exhales with a barely audible sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Someone over here smells very, very  nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking he means her, Wanda's lips flutter in a brief,  involuntary smile. Meanwhile, the Scriptgirl turns away,  blushing furiously.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Palomino tiptoes again back to his spot. Nicole raises he head and nods once to Nick. She seems to have aroused som real emotion in herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with quiet intensity) Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Nick, I just had a great idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold the roll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Chad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop me if I'm out of line here,  but she says "admired from afar,"  right? Doesn't it make sense to see  Damian up close and her "afar?" You  start on a Close-up of Damian, watch  me here; as she declares her love,  the camera moves with me into this  primo two-shot that you and the  Wolfmeister have set up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it. This is Ellen's  scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know; it sort of makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you did it, man. It's all there  in the writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have to relight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pauses, thinking hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still ahead of schedule, Nick;  if that means anything to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Gaffer) Get me a tweenie right here, with  diffusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, everyone stand by. We're pausing  briefly to set one little light,  then we're going again, right away.  Stand-in please for Mr. Palomino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fucking light!

dialogues.speaker: INT. CRAFT SERVICE TABLE. DAY
dialogues.text: Several members of the crew loiter around the table. The  Scriptgirl approaches carrying a donut in one hand and a of coffee in the other. Palomino notices her and moves qu to her side. Without a word he picks up the milk and pour some in her coffee. Nicole stands nearby and watches the  following exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure. Sugar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino puts sugar in her coffee with extreme care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like jazz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could go hear some tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino smiles and moves away just as Wanda comes up for coffee refill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going well I think. Don't you  think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. What time do you think  we'll finish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early I hope. I'm going to a jazz  club tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? So am I. He's wonderful,  isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so natural, like... air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what his sign is. Do you  know, Nicole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know his sign, but I think  his moon is in Uranus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda chokes hard on her coffee as Nicole walks off with bitter smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be nasty.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Palomino saunters onto the set as Wolf and his crew finis relighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Wolfman. Is this my new mark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until you change it. Where's my  fucking eyepatch?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf walks off. The Gaffer slips the AC a shrewd wink the walks over and stands next to Palomino, giving him a big, friendly grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, whatya say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Bob. I'm lighting this show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad Palomino; Actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the ac) Hey, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice! Hey, Maurice Chevalier! Any  relation? Probably not. Hey, smoking  crew guys, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gaffer slips his own script out of his back pocket an begins leafing through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey thanks, Chad. Actually I wrote a  script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino takes the Gaffer's script and holds it up to his eyes, shading them from a light he's looking at across th room. He points to the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bill. See that light over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower it about three feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino hands the Gaffer back his script and walks off. Gaffer and AC stand in silence for a long awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BATHROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick intently scrutinizes himself in the mirror. Leaning  closer he makes a careful adjustment to the way his hair  falls over his ear, then steps back to examine himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you care to have a drink  tonight? Hey, Nicole, what do you  say you and I have a drink tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the door opens behind him and Nicole walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Nick! I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK, no problem. I'm just  slapping a little water on my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two stand in embarrassed silence for a moment. Nick l like he's gathering the nerve to ask her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, it's going pretty good, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? Something feels off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you seem a little tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't worry about it. Just take  your attention off yourself and put  it on Chad. Work off him a little  more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, I'll try that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And listen, I know he's no Olivier.  But he's got something, don't you  think? Kind of a natural presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, he's very natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hesitates, again gathering his nerves to pop the  question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Nicole... anything else I can  help you with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually there is. Could you maybe  ask him to brush his teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Wanda crosses the set and assumes her position beside the camera. Wolf sits behind it, barely a foot away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My eye is killing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your eyepatch on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that little light set yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little light was set ten minutes  ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into her walkie) Get me the A Team in here right away.  Nick, Nicole, and Mr. Palomino. (to Wolf) Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're not worried about the  time, I'm not worried about the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I am very worried about the time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think it means?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what it means!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes you do, you know exactly what  it means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you're talking  about! Why are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand me, Wanda! You  have no idea --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand you?!! All I do  is take care of you!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick suddenly runs up just as Wolf and Wanda are on the v of blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey! What the hell's going  on here?! Jesus, Wanda. This is a  very intimate scene and a lot of  tension on the set doesn't help. OK?  Now, Wolf, let's just go through the  first part of the move. Damian, on  your new mark. Good. Close-up, Damian;  Ellen in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick suddenly sees Palomino is wearing a black eyepatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chad, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's my fucking eyepatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf, could I borrow it? Cause I'm  telling you, Nick; it really feels  right. I feel like this guy now,  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Chad. I don't think it  works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong, man. I'm going to fight  you on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's my fucking eyepatch and I  don't want anyone wearing it. It's  insanitary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino removes the eyepatch and tosses it back to Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll get my own. Nick, send  someone out for an eyepatch. I'll  fucking pay for it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pulls Palomino aside and whispers to him confidentia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Chad. I didn't want to say  this in front of Wolf but it makes  you look a little... gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino sneaks a glance back at Wolf then whispers to Ni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Thanks, buddy. Good  call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second. You need a rehearsal,  Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just fucking shoot it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Lobo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino winks at Nick and walks back to his new mark, ma a barely audible howling sound behind his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going for picture. Lock it up. And  roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene begins again. Palomino milks his Close-up for a it's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always admired you from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admired? That sounds rather  professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then: loved. How does that  sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on his cue, Palomino walks to the bed. As the camer moves into the 2-shot he begins stroking Nicole's hair wi extreme care and concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds like the champagne talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've loved you from the moment we  met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were working together. I didn't  want anything to interfere -- God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the onslaught of escalating hair-stroking, Nicole  suddenly jerks her head away hard. Palomino jumps up and  begins pacing at the rear of the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a cut. Hold the work, going  again, right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Nick. I don't know why I  did that. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino suddenly stops pacing and addresses Nick with a  curtness that is a little startling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, could I talk to you a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino disappears behind the set, a jerk of his head  indicating his wish for Nick to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A momentary delay. Everyone stand  by. We're going again, right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Ellen? You were a tad low  on that take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, OK. I'll bring it up. Actually  could I listen to the take before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sound man gives Nicole his headphones and rewinds the tape recorder for her. The first several lines of the las take are heard through the headphones.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OFF THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick follows Palomino behind the set, stopping just besid the fake set window. Palomino whirls on Nick and whispers fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out of here, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, but I made a big mistake  taking this part. Have someone call  me a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second, Chad. Just talk to  me. What's going on!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't act with this woman. I know  she's a friend of yours but I got to  tell you: she cannot act worth a  shit! I'm giving her everything! The  whole thing I just did with the hair;  did you see that? I came up with  that on my own because I thought it  would help her. But no, she's giving  me nothing! I'm out of here.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nicole listens to the last line of the previous take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, and all this time I thought... (the muted rustle of  the kiss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sound man stops the recorder at the end of the take,  sets the machine in standby mode, and picks up his crossw puzzle. Nicole is just about to take off the headphones w she realizes she can hear Nick and Palomino talking quite clearly. Glancing up, she sees the Boom man has left his  boom leaning against the wall, the mike pointing out the  open set window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you cast her? She sucked in  that Richard Gere movie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. She is not the best  actress in the world. I see that now  but you've got to help me, Chad. I'm  asking you to please help me here.  We've got to get through this somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera begins a slow DOLLY in to Nicole's astonished  face. This will be intercut with a similar DOLLY in to th microphone leaning against the wall, ending in an ECU of mike.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OFF THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Camera is close on Nick and Palomino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what this is about,  man. You know why she took a cab  this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something came up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She was in my hotel room and she  didn't want you to know it. OK? I'm  sorry it had to come out like this  but I told her this morning "thanks  a lot, it was a lot of fun last night  but let's get something straight --  it was just a one-time deal," and  she didn't want to hear that. She  wanted more, you see what I'm saying?  It's rejection.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: The camera reveals Nicole now seated in her spot on the b She rises as Nick and Palomino reappear and approach her  from behind the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole, listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
