dialogues.text: Nick, it's my fault the scene isn't  working. I apologize. Chad, I  apologize to you too. I'm completely  unfocused here and I think you're  absolutely right; what we need to do  is loosen the scene up somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Palomino stare at Nicole for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if we could try  improvising the scene. More along  the lines of what Chad has been doing.  Maybe that would help me find  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's smile of gratitude to Nicole looks almost drug-ind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fantastic idea. What do you  think, Chad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's the only way I can work.  Let's take it apart, let's cut loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! And we'll shoot it! Hell, why  not?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll that motherfucking camera,  Wolfie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss my ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although Wolf says this quite loud, Palomino doesn't hear him because he suddenly yells:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, now we're making a fucking  movie! Call it, Wanda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going for picture. Lock it up. And  roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take five!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole stays seated, though Palomino moves around making great show of loosening up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always admired you from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you? That's, wow; that's  incredible. But that sounds kind of  professional doesn't it? Admired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. How does despised sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! (laughs) What's it mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) It's sort of like I think you're a  piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino is somewhat startled by this. He looks to Nick i confusion. Nick silently encourages him to keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (another laugh) That sounds like the champagne  talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not. I really do think you are  a piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't. You love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck I do. I can't stand looking  at you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess I have nothing else to  say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think you have a lot more to  say, Damian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I am surprised you feel this  way, Ellen. I always thought you  admired --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant. You should  tell everyone what you just told  Nick behind the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this isn't part of the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it anyway: The reason this scene  isn't working is because you and I  slept together last night. Did  everyone hear that?! I fucked Chad  last night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and the rest of the crew stand in stunned amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, Nick! I told you this was about  rejection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking scumbag! You think I  give a rat's ass about you?! I was  there to get laid and even that was  a joke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you are really starting to  piss me off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, does that mean you're not going  to come wiggle on the bed anymore,  or stroke my hair real soft and  concerned, or kiss me like a soap  opera acting piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino snaps, and lunges for Nicole. She leaps to the o side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! I'll kick your ass! Come  on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick steps between Nicole and Palomino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, guys, I think we can stop there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet your ass we can stop! Wanda,  call me a cab!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Chad. Let's just try to  calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I'm out of here, man. This  movie is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a second, Chad. There's no  reason for hostility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, you fucking loser. The only  reason I took this part was because  someone said you knew Quentin  Tarantino! You're nowhere, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you want to go? Go! I'm sick of  your shit, you hostess twinkie  motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hostess twinkie motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino suddenly punches Nick in the stomach, leaving hi bent over and gasping for breath. Nicole instantly leaps Palomino's back and begins pounding her fist on the top o his head. Palomino spins wildly trying to dislodge her as Wanda rushes forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, everyone just stop. Stop!  Stop this right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she tries to separate Nicole and Palomino, Palomino sh her hard, knocking her down. Instantly Wolf leaps off the camera and runs up to Palomino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you've asked for it, Chad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palomino suddenly punches Wolf in the teeth, dropping him like a stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrieks) Wolf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Nick staggers to his feet and rushes at Palomino His momentum knocks all three backwards onto the bed,  Palomino's head cracking Nicole in the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole rolls free as Nick and Palomino wrestle on the bed Nick gets Palomino in a vicious headlock and starts pound his head against the mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to pick my brain?! This is  the way I direct hostess twinkie  scumbags like you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick continues to pound Palomino's head the Gaffer not Palomino's eyes are starting to bug out from the pressure Nick's forearm around his neck. He and the Boom man rush  forward and finally manage to pry Palomino free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him out of here! Someone take  him back to his hotel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Gaffer and Boom man drag off the almost unconsciou Palomino, the Scriptgirl takes one faltering step after h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffling) Chad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, everything becomes quiet except for Nick's labo breathing and the Scriptgirl's sniffles. Nick leans over touches Nicole's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gaffer and AC help the still-groggy Palomino into the back of the production van. JEFF, the driver, watches the in sleepy curiosity. With Palomino safely propped in a seat, the AC goes back the set. The Gaffer waits a moment then slips his script of his back pocket and slaps it into Palomino's motionles hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called "Tsunami." A Japanese  tidal wave hits New York. You've an  ex-Navy S.E.A L. frogman, working  undercover. You save the city. You'd  be perfect for the lead. That's my  number; call me, or I'll call you.  Either way it's been great working  with you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Palomino stares at him blankly, the Gaffer slams the d The car pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick and Nicole are sitting up on the bed, alone on the n empty set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole, I'm sorry. I didn't mean it.  You were great in that Richard Gere  movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. You're no different than he  is. You lie, you're deceitful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not lying. Christ, I tell everyone  how great you are. I've got nothing  but respect and admiration for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, now you're doing your own  fucking script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why do you think I wrote it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about you. It's about how I  feel about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, did you get a bump on your  head, Nicky. 'Cause you're talking  like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole. I've loved you since the day  we met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole sits for a long moment in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want anything to get in the  way of us working together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, and all this time I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Nicole move into a shy, trembling, heartfelt kis

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL ROOM. DAWN
dialogues.text: Nicole snaps awake with a jolt. She glances quickly at th clock which reads 4:35. The sound of the shower still run in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole leaps out of bed and races into the bathroom. As t camera follows her, she closes the bathroom door, right  against the lens, turning the image to total BLACKNESS. The frame is BLACK. The recognizable clatter and clunk of the FILM CREW is heard. Wanda's voice is prominent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go out that door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a DOOR opens away from camera and the AC stops, foot away from the lens. Behind him, Wanda and the rest o the crew can be seen through the door, preparing for film We see now the door and the plywood walls around it are F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's part of the set, goddamnit. Now  go around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time. This is an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AC rushes past and a moment later the camera DOLLIES  slowly through the fake door toward Wanda pacing near the set camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into her walkie) Has Ellen showed up yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ssss... kkkkkrrk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her into wardrobe right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ssskk... ssssrrrk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Scene six; Scene five has been  postponed. I'm not going to say it  again; Mr. Palomino is not working  today. Now where is that smoke  machine!

dialogues.speaker: INT. SET BUILDING, HALLWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: The AC bursts through a door at the end of the hallway an walks quickly toward the camera. Without knocking he push open the bathroom door and suddenly stops short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on his tiptoes at the sink, straining to turn of the running faucet is, TITO a DWARF. He is dressed in a s blue tuxedo with tails. A top hat and white gloves rest o the closed toilet seat. Tito appears extremely annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to use the bathroom. Kind of  an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, fucking knock!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito grabs his hat and gloves and marches down the hall, AC staring after him in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering) I swear to Christ, one of these days  I'm going to punch somebody in the  balls!

dialogues.speaker: INT. WARDROBE ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Camera is close on Nicole, her eyes clenched shut as a th white veil is placed on her head. Camera pulls back to re SACHIKO, the Costume Designer putting the finishing touch to Nicole's costume, which appears to be an elaborate whi wedding gown. Nick stands nearby, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as we pull up to your apartment  Palomino suddenly says he feels so  sick he can't work today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. Was it something he ate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand up, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he work tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know that either. But I'm not  worrying about it. I had this dream  last night where I was on the set.  You were in it, and another woman,  someone older. Anyway, everything  was going wrong. The harder I tried  to hold things together the more  they fell apart. And you know what  that dream was telling me, Nicole?  You just got to roll with it. And  that's what I'm doing, I'm rolling  with it. So, we'll just shoot the  Dream Sequence today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Tito walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Tito. You look great, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you look good. Thanks for coming  in on such short notice. This is  Nicole; she's playing Ellen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Toto, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, if there's anything I can do  to make you... if you need... uh,  just let me know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a stool in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito walks out, followed immediately by Sachiko, leaving  Nicole alone with Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I just offend him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Short notice?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on; that was nothing. I'm the  one who called him "Toto." Jesus,  I'm out of it. I dreamt I was on the  set last night too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You were in the dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I freaking out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great: I freak out in my dream;  I freak out in your dream. No wonder  I'm fucking exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole stares at Nick for a long moment then smiles brief and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. A CORNER OF THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: A dented, ancient smoke machine squats forlornly in the m of the set. WOLF (with eyepatch), the GAFFER, AC, BOOM MA and the SOUND MAN stand around it, scrutinizing it intent Wolf seems in an unusually good mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, guys; special effects today.  Could be fun. Who knows how to work  this baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the old T-160. I used it once  in '85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. '85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where the gas goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's where the oil goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. It's coming back now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to let you handle this  one, Bob. This is your baby. And  Les, if he needs help you give him a  hand. OK, guys? We're all working  together today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf walks off. The Gaffer kneels to inspect the smoke ma closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup, all coming back now. Like riding  a bike. T-160, 1985. 1985, T-160.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda stands alone by the camera, looking around at the  bustling crew like a battalion commander watching her tro in battle. Nick approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we doing, Wanda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good, Nick. Not bad, but not  good. We need to finish this scene  and do Scene thirty-one today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene thirty-one?! I left my notes  for Scene thirty-one at home! I didn't  know we were --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Nick. I'll send someone to  your apartment to pick them up. Now,  relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, OK. Send somebody to my apartment  to pick them up; it's the red  notebook, under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taken care of, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Great. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks off quickly, muttering to himself. A moment la Wolf strolls up to Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all lit, the smoke machine is  under control; we're ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard) What about the dolly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just need to see a run-through and  we're all set. I'm going to make  your job easy today, Wanda. Wandaful. (he slips his arm  around her) Mmm, I'm glad you wore that perfume.  And don't worry about Palomino; I'll  take you to a jazz club tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I can't make it. I have to go  see Chad; he's extremely ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, by the way my eye's much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Wolf, this may not be the  best time to say this but our  relationship is going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't take it personally.  Because I care for you, Wolf, I really  do. But I've had this feeling for  quite a while and I think it's time  we ended it. OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good. Still friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, cause we still have to work  together and there's no reason it  has to be unpleasant. Give me a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda and Wolf move into an extremely wooden embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a real special guy, Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda slips Wolf a tender smile then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into her walkie) OK, let's get the A Team in please!  Nick, Ellen, Mr. Tito!

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick is working with the crew and the actors. The set con of two flats (one with the fake door) joined to make a co The flats are painted fire-engine red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, here's the shot. We start wide  with Ellen standing absolutely still  right in the middle of the frame.  You got that, Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (notices eyepatch) What happened to your eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's a little sensitive  today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) Of course I can see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment Nick looks like he might snap back at Wolf b he draws a deep breath and continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Ellen is standing there. The  smoke is flowing in and: Ellen's  line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, Tito, that's your cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fake door opens and Tito enters wearing his top hat a carrying a golden apple in his gloved hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walk around her once, hold the  apple out, that's right; just beyond  her reach. You're staring at her  hard. Harder, good. Then stop right  here. Can we get a mark, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AC moves up to Nick and places a piece of yellow tape the floor. CU the yellow tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we dolly in to Tito's Close-up.  Alright, Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be hand-held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think it's better on the dolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, do I see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just the apple. And Tito, right  after we dolly in give me a little  laugh there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little laugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big, little; anything you feel like  doing. OK? Good. Let's shoot one.  Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, here we go. Camera back to One.  Action on the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gaffer turns on the smoke machine which emits a pathe wisp of smoke that immediately dissipates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, Wanda. Can we get a little  more smoke? Is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gaffer adjusts a knob and another thin puff of smoke  wheezes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going for picture. Lock it up. And  roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE DREAM. TAKE ONE. DAY
dialogues.text: Nicole stands motionless in the middle of the empty set. white wedding gown stands out sharply against the deep re walls. A sad shred of smoke drifts by her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito opens the door and walks in, staring hard at Nicole. His sky-blue tuxedo gleams in the rich light. He walks ar her in a circle holding the golden apple just beyond her  reach. He stops on his mark and the camera dollies into a of him. He doesn't laugh. Nick watches this for a moment intense concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a cut. Nick; comments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just a couple. I thought that  was uh... good. Tito, that was very  good, man, really. You didn't feel  like laughing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I laughed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, OK; I guess I missed it. You  could make it bigger if you want.  And Ellen, maybe just a little more  tension when you see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I didn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, maybe you see him a little  bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'm confused. Do I see him  or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, what is the tension? Who is Toto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard) It's Tito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. I'm sorry, Tito. I don't  know why I'm doing that. I'm really  sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, come on now; concentrate.  Remember; you're marrying Damian  tomorrow. You're a little anxious.  You have this dream. Let's call it  an Anxiety Dream, and Tito represents  the anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU Tito looking none too happy about this representation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK? It seems pretty simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. And Bob, let's really have  some smoke on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, more smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think it should be hand-held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I don't want it hand- held. I want it on the dolly. Where's  my notebook, Wanda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On it's way, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock it up. Going for picture. And  roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole stands motionless as a few more emaciated puffs of smoke hang in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito enters, walks around her holding the apple just beyo her reach then moves to his mark. The camera dollies into CU. He does not laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a cut. Going again, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going again, please stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Ellen, good. You're on to  something there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, something's not right. It all  feels fake to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's tone with Nicole suddenly takes on an almost  imperceptible edge, tinged with annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not fake; it's real. Just  remember, you really want the apple.  Tito, I still think we could see  more of a laugh at the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of laugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, OK. A laugh. I'm thinking maybe  like this. Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches Nick demonstrate the laugh. He seems una he resembles a drunken, slightly annoyed idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. OK? And remember,  Tito, this is a dream. Not everything  has to make sense. A laugh right  there heightens our sense of... of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Wolf, how was that for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think it should be hand-held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) Well, God damn it! It's not going to  be! It's on the dolly so just forget  about it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a strained moment of silence on the set as every witnesses this rebuke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bob, what the fuck is that smoke?  Might as well get a couple hamsters  in here blowing smoke rings for  Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The septic valve wasn't open. I got  it now. We're going to see some smoke  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's try another take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, lock it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, could I talk to you for a  minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs in exasperation) Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick follows Wolf off the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release the lock-up. Everyone stand  by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see some smoke now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: INT. A CORNER. DAY
dialogues.text: As soon as Wolf and Nick reach the darkened corner, Wolf  whirls to face Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't like being spoken to  like that, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I don't like your attitude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have an attitude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you don't! Every time I ask  you to do something all I get is No,  No, No and I'm sick of it! I hired  you to do a job; if you're not going  to do it you better let me know right  now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf is about to yell back at Nick when suddenly he stops and lets out a deep, painful sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Nick. I'm going through  some heavy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't really go into it. It's pretty  heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf makes a slight motion with his head toward Wanda who standing some distance away watching them. Seeing the two men looking at her Wanda shoots them a hard glare which  prompts Wolf and Nick to turn away quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal, professional, emotional.  It's doing a number on me. And now  you're telling me you're going to  fire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that, Wolf. Come on,  I'm not going to fire you. You're  doing a great job here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't know what I'd do without  you, man. You've got a great eye. I  just hope it's not the one under  that eyepatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lets out a tense, strained laugh but Wolf's only res is to stare back at him sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Wolf. Let me tell you one  thing I've learned; sometimes you  just have to roll with things. You  know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll with it, man. You'll be OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf lets out another deep sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, bro.

dialogues.speaker: INT. A CORNER OF THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: The Gaffer, Boom man, and AC kneel around the smoke machi A can of gas and a quart of oil stand beside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where the oil goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's where the gas goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you, Bob. That's where  the oil goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester, don't you think Bob knows  where the oil goes?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember using oil in '85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe both the oil and gas go in  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gaffer and Boom man turn and look at the AC for a lon moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he is too. OK, three parts  gas, one part oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gaffer and Boom man pour liberal amounts of gas and o into the T-160.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick rushes up to his position by the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is my notebook here yet, Wanda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any minute, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Call it, Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going for picture. Lock it up. And  roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole stands motionless in her white wedding dress, look genuinely alarmed, possibly because of the huge clouds of smoke now spewing out of the panting smoke machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito enters, stares at her hard and walks around her in a circle holding the apple just beyond her reach. The smoke so thick both of them are barely visible. Just as Tito ge to his mark the smoke machine backfires with a tremendous explosion and begins filling the room with dense, blindin smoke.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: The smoke blanks out the entire frame. Frantic shouts are heard from unseen bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut! Cut! Cut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off! Turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find the switch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull the plug! Bob! Pull the plug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door! Get some water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it! I got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke machine emits a loud hiss and dies, filling the room with sudden silence. Slowly the smoke begins to clea as the crew moves around muttering and coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear the set! Ellen! Tito! Please  step off the set!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm off the set!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who is that? Who is that? Please  step off the set!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of fuzzy-slippered feet enter the smoky frame. The camera BOOMS up, passing over a woman's bare shins, a  flowered, blue silk housecoat until finally coming to res on the pleasantly smiling face of CORA. This is the same  woman who played Ellen's Mother in Part One; she is dress exactly the same as she was in their scene. The camera pu back to reveal JEFF the Intern standing nervously beside with a red notebook in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Nicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gapes in utter astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET PRODUCTION OFFICE. DAY
dialogues.text: Wanda speaks urgently into the phone while Nicole stands  beside her. Jeff (still wearing his hat) waits at a dista clutching Nick's red notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cora Reve, R-E-V-E. Blue housecoat,  blue slippers. How do I know? Because  she's sitting ten feet away from me.  Well sweetheart, that's going to be  a real fucking problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole turns away and walks past Jeff to the Craft Servic table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was waiting outside Nick's  apartment when I went to pick up his  notebook. She said she was looking  for him so I figured I should just  bring her up here. You look really  pretty in that dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole nods politely then looks to the Makeup corner wher Nick sits talking earnestly to his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took a bus in; went right to your  apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get out of your room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I just went right through the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was unlocked!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was locked. I just went through  it. It's something I've learned to  do, Nicky. I can walk through just  about anything; like air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, you've got to stop doing this.  I'm serious. I'm a little upset with  you. You could have gotten lost, or  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to see you. I've missed  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Mom; I've missed you too.  But it's not really a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole approaches, holding up the hem of her wedding gown There is a subtle tension smoldering between her and Nick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sending a car. It should be  here in a couple of hours. They didn't  even know she was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I don't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Nick. If I knew there was  going to be a wedding I would have  worn my fucking hat.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: The camera holds on Tito pacing slowly, alone on the set. is smoking fiercely, holding his top hat with one hand.  Suddenly he begins laughing in a loud, stage bellow.

dialogues.speaker: INT. A CORNER OF THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick sets a chair for his mother and helps her sit down.  Nicole joins Tito on the set and talks quietly to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. How's that, Mom? Can you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the little fellow going to do  gymnastics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito glances up at her quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh! No. Now come on, Mom. You've  got to be quiet. Absolutely quiet.  OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) OK.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. NEAR THE CAMERA. DAY
dialogues.text: Wanda and Wolf stand beside each other in tense, awkward  silence for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good; real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf looks as if he's about to burst into tears as Nick w up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the smoke machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead, Nick. I've got calls out  to every Effects house in the city  but I just can't seem to locate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. We'll shoot without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Nick, it's a Dream Sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way it goes, Wanda. We're  just going to have to roll with it.  Nothing else we can do. We've got to  roll with it, right, Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf meets Nick's eyes and gives an extremely melancholy  nod. Nick turns to address Nicole and Tito and the edge  immediately slips back into his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, here we go. Ellen, you've got to  keep reaching for that apple. I don't  feel that you really want it. I mean,  Christ, how many times do I have to  tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole glares at Nick for a moment then abruptly turns an walks off the set. Nick stares after her in confusion the quickly follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stand by. Nobody move. Going  again, right away.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. NYC. DAY
dialogues.text: Nicole stands with her back to the camera as Nick strides to her with impatience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Nicole. What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me! You're the one with the  bug up your ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait just a second!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been picking on me all day! I  can't do anything right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I was short with you,  Nicole, but I think you can see I'm  under a little pressure here. I'm  shooting a Dream Sequence without a  smoke machine, my mother's out there  thinking she's at a circus wedding  and you tell me the whole movie seems  fake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did too. You said, "Everything  feels fake."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant me! I feel fake! Everything  I'm doing feels fake. I can't act. I  should just do shower scenes in  Richard Gere movies for the rest of  my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole, that's ridiculous. You're a  fantastic actress. All you have to  do is show me you want that apple  more than anything else in the world;  don't give up. Understand? You cannot  give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Wanda yells out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, Nick?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready!

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick rushes back onto the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, here we go. Everybody focus,  concentrate. And Tito, we're still  looking for that little laugh, pal.  OK? Call it, Wanda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture's up. There will be no smoke  in this scene. No smoke. No smoke in  the Dream Sequence. And roll sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene six, take four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, action.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE DREAM. TAKE FOUR. DAY
dialogues.text: Nicole stands motionless in her wedding gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito walks in, stares at her hard, then walks around her  once with the golden apple just beyond her outstretched h He stops and the camera dollies into his CLOSE-UP. Nick  watches in hopeful expectation. He waits and waits but Ti does not laugh. Just then the door in the rear set wall opens and Cora st in, looking oddly puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I thought this was the TV room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a cut. Going again, right  away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OFF THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick escorts his mother back to her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, listen to me. I don't want you  to move from this chair. Do you  understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, you sound just like your  father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, OK. I won't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick walks back on the set and addresses Nicole and Tito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, good. Very good. (laughs) Tito, I think we're having a little  communication problem here. All I  want you to do is laugh. OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me again.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OFF THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Wolf (still wearing his eyepatch) walks over and sits qui in a chair beside Cora. He does not speak to her and gaze blankly out at Nick, Tito, and Nicole on the set some dis away. Cora however stares at the side of his head with su intensity Wolf can't help but turn to her. Cora still doesn't take her eyes off him and in fact star even more intently into his eye. Wolf glances away for a moment then looks back. Cora cont to stare at him. Suddenly, his eye is full of tears. Cora watches in rapt silence. Wolf is crying openly now. Cora  reveals no hint of emotion as she reaches out and gently  lifts the eyepatch off of his eye. A tight smile of  satisfaction creases her lips as a tiny pool of tears is  released, streaming quickly down Wolf's cheek. No one see this.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick paces tensely in front of Nicole and Tito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Tito. It's not that big a deal.  It's a dream, alright. Strange things  happen in a dream. All you have to  do is laugh. Why is that such a  problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does it have to be a dwarf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does my character have to be a  dwarf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have to be a dwarf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why is he?! Is that the only  way you can make this a dream; put a  dwarf in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Tito; that's not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever had a dream with a  dwarf in it?! Do you know anyone  who's had a dream with a dwarf in  it? NO! I don't even have dreams  with dwarves in them! The only place  I've seen dwarves in dreams is in  stupid movies like this! Make it  weird; put a dwarf in it. Everyone  will go "whoa whoa whoa, must be a  dream, there's a fucking dwarf in  it!" Well, I'm sick of it. You can  take this Dream Sequence and shove  it up your ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito hurls his top hat and gloves to the floor and walks  out. Everyone stares at Nick who is frozen in stunned sil Finally Wanda approaches him hesitantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? (no response) I can get right on the phone. We'll  try to get another... small person  here as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's absolutely right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sighs heavily and sinks to sit on the dolly in silen Wolf appears behind him, still wiping his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to just shoot Ellen, Nick?  She could be in the dream by herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We're not going to shoot anything.  I'm sorry. Thanks for all your help,  but it's over. I can't take it  anymore. I tried to roll with it but  it's time to face the music; I can't  do this. I am not a director. The  shoot is over. I give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's speech has the simple eloquence of truth; he is no bitter or self-pitying. He seems unaware of how disturbin this is to the crew. They all stand around him in shock,  afraid to move or speak. Finally Wolf turns to the AC and puts his hand on his shoulder, like a father to his young son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the camera off the dolly. Start  putting it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches the AC unfasten the camera in silence. N stands alone on the set in her wedding dress, still holdi the golden apple. Her face is frozen in dismay. Suddenly  CORA comes through the set door and marches up to Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that apple!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sound of his mother's voice, Nick looks up. He see her snatch the apple from Nicole's hand and march back ou the door, closing it behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind the door) I'm ready, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: INT. BY THE CAMERA. DAY
dialogues.text: Nick gets up slowly and whispers intensely to Wanda, Wolf and the rest of the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll camera. Roll sound. Let's go.  Right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf grabs the camera and puts it on his shoulder (hand-h as the rest of the crew moves quickly and silently into  position. On a terse signal from Nick the camera starts  rolling.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. THE DREAM. DAY
dialogues.text: Nicole takes the silent "action" cue from Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on cue Cora walks through the door, holding the gol apple out in front of her. She circles Nicole with  determination, seemingly oblivious to Nick and the rest o the crew hovering behind Wolf as he begins following her  with the hand-held camera. Wolf is now in his element; gl like Nureyev with the camera. When he pans suddenly with  Cora the whole crew ducks wildly and dives out of camera  range. Cora finally stops circling Nicole and stops abruptly.  Suddenly she raises the apple right out in front of Nicol Wolf glides forward with the camera, framing an amazing C of the apple with Nicole seen behind it. Nicole reaches o grabs the apple and takes a huge, resounding bite out of CU Nick's face, eyes wide in anxious delight. Cora takes one step forward. CU her fuzzy slippers stoppi right on the yellow tape mark. Cora waits momentarily unt Wolf has reframed both her and Nicole, then lets out a hu laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And cut!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General mayhem erupts on the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf, talk to me, man! Did you get  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it, Nick! Everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Close-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. See? That's what I meant  about going hand-held!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a genius, man! What about the  focus?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nailed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf slaps the AC's palm, then the Gaffer's standing righ beside him. He turns gleefully to the next person but see it is Wanda he rigidly turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going again, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was the sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use another but definitely  acceptable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick runs up to his mother and throws his arms around her Nicole stands beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, you kook! That was incredible!  Did you know we were filming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testily) Of course I knew you were filming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great, you're a natural.  And Nicole, that was beautiful. Don't  you dare tell me that felt fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, on an impulse surprising both of them, Nick and Nicole embrace. Just then Wanda steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going again, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hold on. Let me think a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The set grows suddenly quiet as Nick begins pacing rapidl muttering to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I use it for the Dream Sequence,  that's the question. Does it work  for the Dream Sequence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick suddenly looks up and sees everybody staring at him; Nicole in her wedding gown, Wolf with his eyepatch, his m still eating the apple, Wanda, the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going with it, Wanda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright everyone, listen up. That is  a wrap on Scene Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The set erupts in applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! Hold it! Hold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to record room tone. I'll  need thirty seconds of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, alright! Quiet. Quiet! Shut up!!  Thirty seconds of room tone. The  sooner you're quiet the sooner we're  done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Nick) What's room tone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for the sound, Mom. We just  have to be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment a door opens at the rear of the set and a  DOCTOR and NURSE enter. The Nurse carries an extra overco Jeff, the Driver, turns and sternly whispers for them to quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And roll sound. Nobody move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: The camera is wide, showing the entire set, actors, and c Everyone stands in perfect silence, as motionless as stat As the silence continues the mood on the set gradually  changes. One by one people drift into their own private w of reflection. MS the Sound man, alternately watching his recorder and h stopwatch. Behind him the Boom man holds the mike in posi to record general ambiance while staring off into the  distance. CU the tape recorder spinning in quiet precision. CU the stopwatch, its giant second hand showing five seco have passed. MS Nick standing next to his mother who drapes one arm  casually over Nick's shoulder. Nick glances up and sees N beside him, absorbed in her own thoughts. Suddenly she lo up and her eyes meet Nick's. She slips him the barest hin of a smile. The camera DOLLIES slowly through the standing, silent gr passing over faces in different degrees of thought. CU the Sound man's stopwatch, the giant second hand showi ten seconds have passed. MS Nick. He is so immersed in thought he looks at no one. The camera slowly DOLLIES into a CU of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAD PALOMINO stands at a gleaming podium, looking radian in an immaculate tuxedo. He holds an envelope in his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a new category this year:  Best Film Ever Made by a Human Being.  And the winner is none other than my  Best Bud, Nick Reve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid thunderous applause Nick bounds on the stage and acc an Oscar from Chad. He stands grinning like an idiot as t applause continues.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: MS Nick, still wrapped in thought, his lips starting to f the same idiotic smile. MS Nicole. The camera DOLLIES slo into her face, now tinged with a slight uneasiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot at the counter. Nicole stands facing a large ba man with his back to the camera. She is wearing a cheap p waitress uniform and has her hair under a hairnet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had any experience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was an actress for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls her headshot out of her shoulder bag and hands to the man with a hopeful smile. He flips over the headsh and looks at her credits with confused annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but can you cook a hamburger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doubtfully) Probably.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: MS Nicole. She jerks her head slightly in response to thi moment of thought. CU the stopwatch, showing fifteen seconds have passed. MS Wolf. The camera begins a slow DOLLY into his CU.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WANDA'S APT. DAY
dialogues.text: Wolf stands like Thor in the middle of the Red Set, his a crossed over his chest, his jaw set in determination. Smo billows around him. At his feet, dressed in Nicole's wedd gown, Wanda sobs hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf, I'm sorry! Please forgive me!  I love you, Wolf! Please! Give me  one more chance. Let me prove it! I  love you! I love you, Wolf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf remains unmoved for a long moment. Finally he reache out with a forgiving smile and pats Wanda's head.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: MS Wolf. He glances furtively at Wanda with a trace of ho still in his eyes. MS Wanda, looking off. The camera DOLLIES into her CU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the same hotel room from Part Two, in which we sa Nicole and Chad Palomino. At the moment Wanda and Chad li panting in the sweat-soaked sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I love about you, Chad, is you're  not afraid of my power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Wanda! I love your power.  It's like an afferdesiac to me!

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: MS Wanda. She shifts slightly and glances quickly around  her. Her smile is tinged with the hint of sexual pleasure MS the Gaffer, frowning, absorbed in thought. The camera  DOLLIES into a CU of him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. A CHEAP RESTAURANT. DAY
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a CU of an incredibly beautiful hamburger being placed in a toasted bun on a gleaming white oval plate. A hand places a garnish of parsley on it then carries the p to the lunch counter. Camera PANS to reveal the GAFFER si on the stool. He picks up the hamburger and takes a huge  bite out of it. This shot holds for quite some time as he continues to chew.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: MS The Gaffer. A hopeful, delicious smile spreading over face. CU the Sound man's stopwatch, the giant second hand showi twenty seconds have passed. MS Cora. She gazes serenely out before her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NURSING HOME. DAY
dialogues.text: In the pale afternoon light, Cora stands in the middle of her drab, barren room. She appears to be staring at the d Suddenly she begins striding toward it. Effortlessly, eas she walks right through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick still stands at the podium with his Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In closing I'd like to say to all  the people who told me not to make  this movie, who wouldn't meet with  me or return a simple phone call. To  my favorite professor at Film School  whose parting advice to me was to  take a job teaching at a women's  college. To Delores DelSporto, the  girl I loved in high school who left  me for a Jr. Varsity football player:  to all these people I'd like to say  thank you but I can't because what I  really feel like saying is go fu -- !!

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE SET. DAY
dialogues.text: MS Nick, his head and body jerking in a sudden spasm. He  finishes the last word of his speech in a choked whisper the Sound man frowns hard at him. CU the Sound man's stopwatch showing twenty-five seconds  have passed. The camera stays on the watch until the fina five seconds have elapsed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, that's a cut on room tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room erupts with activity. Everyone moves and talks a once. Nick whispers something to Nicole then runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, strike the set. Props! Art  Department! Redress for Scene thirty- one. Let's go! Right away people!  Nick! Nick! Anyone seen Nick?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WS the set. Suddenly the fake door closes right into the  lens, turning the frame completely BLACK. END CREDITS.
